critique: This document pertains to trade agreements and the role of the Tariff Commission. It outlines procedures for reviewing and investigating trade-agreement concessions. There's no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideology. Immigration is not directly addressed. The executive power is somewhat expanded as it directs the Tariff Commission. Federalism is not a major factor. National security vs. civil liberties is not directly relevant. Economic regulation is present, as the document deals with trade agreements and tariffs, suggesting government intervention. Social inclusion is not addressed.
